content.description: Super easy, super obvious. look for the ramp on the left side of the main face. To the low right end of the ramp where it meets the ground, look above for the low in-cut rail to stand start at.Travel left up the ramp using all hands available and some balancy footwork. Top out the lip up and left and walk off.
content.location: Super easy, super obvious. look for the ramp on the left side of the main face.

content.description:
To the right of the main, overhung face look for a sidepull and an undercling "point" for the stand start of "Hail Storm".

 Pull onto the start and work up to two sloped drop-stone pinches. Hold the swing/foot cut and work up and right to a nice knobby top out.

 ---The name of this line comes from the exciting weather during the first ascent. While working this problem a sudden thunderstorm passed by and covered the forest floor with ice. 30min later the problem was topped out.

Start from the sit to the far right of the face (to the right of the small scoop) with your right hand in the deep jug sidepull. 

  Make a big pull to a gaston and follow past to the jug dropstone at the lip. Continue over the lip past knobs until you can hit the far upper edge of the boulder to top out.

This boulder is a steep wave-like face with increasingly difficult lines on it. To the far right is "George Michael" which is a good, easy going line. Anything left of "Hail Storm" is still a project. 

  Good landings, easy to get to.
